_header: Ay Gods mercy said our Host tho
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the ‘Merchant’s Endlink’ of the Canterbury Tales — 22 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Ey godis mercy seide our ost thonow such a wiff I pray god kepe vs
                    fro…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and eke my witt suffisith not thertoto tellen al therfore my
                    tale is do

BodBar20.Transcription:
I haue a wif þogh she pore beȜit she hath an hepe of vices
                    loffor of hir tong a mochel shrew is sheAnd to my wil þe
                    contrarie wil she doþerof no force lat al suche þinges goBut
                    wite ȝe wat in conseil be it saideMe reweth sore þat I am to hir
                    taide
BodBar20.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8 (5024), introducing the Franklin’s
                    Tale.
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here bygynneth þe prologe of þe ffrankeleyn (f.
                        103v).

Bod686.First Lines:
Ey goddes mercy seide oure hoost þoNow such a wyf y prey god
                    kepe me fro…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And eke my witte suffiseth not þer toTo tellen alle
                    wherefor my tale is do
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth þe prologe of þe Squyers tale (f. 129);
                    Squyer (RT)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
Ey goddis merci seid oure oost þoNow sich a wife I pray god
                    kepe me fro…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…And eke my wit suffiseth not there toTo tellen all wherefor
                    my tale is do
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…Here foloueth þe wordes of oure Hoost to the ffrankeleyn (f.
                        98v); The wordez of þe ffrankeleyn (RT)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
EYe god mercy seide oure hoost þooNow suche a wif I preie god
                    kepe me froo…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…And eek my witt suffiseþ not þertoTo telle alle
                    þerfore my tale is doo
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…HEre begynneþ þe prolog of þe squier (f. 161);
                    þe squier (RT)

BodLauMis739.Transcription:
[y] haue awyfe ȝogh she
                    pore beYit haith she an hepe of vices loffor of her tong a mochil
                    shrew is sheTherof no force late all suche thinges gooffor to my wille
                    þe contrarie will she doBut witte ȝe what in counsaile be hit
                    saideMe rewith sore þat I am to hir tayde
BodLauMis739.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.

OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…And eke my witte suffiseth nat thertooTo tellen alle wherfore
                    my witte is doo

Ey goddis mercy seide oure hoste

Eye god mercy seid oure oste þooNowe suche a wyffe I pray god
                    kepe me froo…

CamFitzMc181.Transcription:
I Haue a wyfe quoth oure oste though sche pore beYete hath sche an
                    hepe of vyces looffor of hur tong a schrewe ys scheeffor to my wylle
                    þe contrary woll sche dooTherof no forse lete all such thynges
                    gooBut wote ye what in counsel be hit seydMe reweth sore þat y am
                    to hur tyed
CamFitzMc181.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a nine-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.
CamFitzMc181.Attributed Title: The prolog of þe ffrancleyn xii (f. 118)

                    fro…
BLAdd5140.Last Lines:

                    tale is do

BLHar1758.Transcription:
Haue a wif quod our Oost thogh sche pore beYet hath sche an hepe of
                    vices loffor of hir tonge a schrewe is scheffor to my wille the
                    contrarie will sche doTher of no fors late all suche thynges goBut
                    wite ye what in counceile be it seideMe rewith sore that I am to hir
                    teide
BLHar1758.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.

BLHar7334.First Lines:

                    wherfor my tale is do

BLRoy17Dxv.First Lines:
Ey goddes mercy sayde ower Oste thoNow suche A wyfe I praye god
                    kepe me ffro…
BLRoy17Dxv.Last Lines:
…And eke my wytte suffyceþe notte thertoTo tellen all
                    wherfor my tale is doo
BLRoy17Dxv.Note:
Preceded by the ‘Man of Law’s Endlink’ (4316) and followed by
                    the ‘Squire’s Headlink’ (5024).

BLRoy18Cii.Transcription:
I haue a wyf þou she pore beYit she hath an heepe of vyces
                    loFor of hire tonge a moche shrew is sheAnd to my wylle þe
                    contrarye wil she doTherof no force lete all suche þinges goBut
                    wyte ȝe what in consail be it saideMe rewyth sore þat I am to
                    hire taide
BLRoy18Cii.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.

BLSl1685.Transcription:
I haue a wyfe þouȝe she pore beȜit hathe she an hepe
                    of vices loffor of hir tonge a moche shrewe ys shoffor to my wylle
                    þe contrary wolle she dooTherof no force let alle suche þenges
                    goBut wytte ȝe what in counsaylayle be hit saydMe rewethe sore
                    þat I am to hir teyde
BLSl1685.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.
BLSl1685.Attributed Title:
…Here bygynnyth þe Prologe of þe ffrankeleyn (f.
                    145)

Alnwick455.Transcription:
I have a wyffe quod our hoost þouȝ she pore beȜit hath
                    she an hepe of vicis loffor of hir tung a shrewe is sheTherof no force
                    let al such thingis gooBut woot yee what in counsell be it seydMe
                    rewith sore that I am to hir teyde
Alnwick455.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.
Alnwick455.Attributed Title: Here begynnyth the ffranklen his prologg (f. 130v)

Lichfield29.Transcription:
I haue a wyf quod oure ost though she pore beȜit hath she an
                    heep of vices loffor of hir tonge a moche shrewe is sheffor to my
                    wille the contrari wol she doTher of no force lat alle suche þinges
                    goBut wite ȝe what in counsayl be it saydMe reweth sore that I am
                    to hir tayd
Lichfield29.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a seven-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.
Lichfield29.Attributed Title: …and by / gynneth the Prologe of the ffrankeleyn (f. 153)

Lincoln110.First Lines:
[E]y goodes mercy quod oure host thoNow suych a wyf I pray god kepe
                    me fro
Lincoln110.Last Lines:
[trimmed]ek my wit suffisith nat ther toTo tellen al þerfore my
                    tale ysdo
Lincoln110.Note:
The main scribe left a blank space of two lines at the foot of f. 91 and
                    of fiteen lines at the top of f. 91v. A second scribe added
                    IV.2419-20 at the foot of f. 91 and the remainder of the ‘Merchant’s
                    Epilogue’ in the blank space on f. 91v, resorting to the margin
                    for the final five lines.
Lincoln110.Attributed Title: The wordes of oure host (f. 91, margin)

Petworth7.First Lines:

TokyoTak32.Transcription:
I have awyif thowgh sche pore beeYit hath sche an heepe of vicis
                    looffor of hiere tvnge a schrewe is scheeffore to my will thee
                    contrarie wole sche dooTheer offe no foors lete all swiche thyngis
                    gooBut wite yee what in cvnseyill bee it seydMee Rewyht sore that I am
                    to hiere teyd
TokyoTak32.Note:
Present in this MS in this seven-line form and followed by a nine-line
                    version of V.1-8, introducing the Franklin’s Tale.
TokyoTak32.Attributed Title:
Here be gynnyht the prologe of the frankelyn (f. 81va); the
                    frankeleynis tale (RT)
